snippet: The Supreme Court debated the nature and value of diversity in higher education and the role of the courts in policing how much weight admissions officers may assign to race.
abstract: Supreme Court debates the merits of diversity in higher education while hearing arguments in the Fisher v Texas affirmative action case; questions asked by the court's conservative members indicate that they are prepared to limit aspects of a 2003 decision allowing colleges to consider race as one of many factors in admissions decisions.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court debated the nature and value of diversity in higher education and the role of the courts in policing how much weight admissions officers may assign to race.

headline.seo: A Changed Court Revisits Affirmative Action in College Admissions
headline.main: Justices Weigh Race as Factor at Universities
headline.print_headline: Justices Weigh Race as Factor at Universities
